TopicTitle: [1.4.3]ALCOR,"Advanced Landing Capsule for Orbital Rendezvous" by ASET (08/02/2017)

Articles.Content: Wow, are you even going to do an interplanetary command pod? If you are still going to do the modular pods we are going to get a lot of stuff! Your dedication is incredible, IVA is so underconsidered in vanilla, so your work is very appreciated!

I ran a minmus mission today, entirely IVA with the HUD turned off via F2, only occasionally switching to Map View to add nodes. This mod is wonderful.

"Current TWR" is the info field I never knew I needed... incredibly helpful for landing! Going too fast, put the number just above one, want to descend a bit faster and peg it at <1. Now I've had some of my best landings ever, entirely in IVA.

Also, fixed the ActiveTextureManagement issue... for now I just blacklisted anything in the /ASET folder, cleared the cache, and now everything is clear and sharp.

Holy crap, that attention to detail in the pod is stunning. I love being able to manually crank open the inner airlock door to go EVA. The Engineer displays are great too; the secondary screens are useful for putting up a biome map and ship log that didn't fit on the primaries Also, the little velcroed-on timers are both super-cute and really help make useful information salient, especially time-to-node. The MFD UI in this version is a lot better as well. --- a release of this to put on my other RPM displays would be fantastic.

Also, fixed the ActiveTextureManagement issue... for now I just blacklisted anything in the /ASET folder, cleared the cache, and now everything is clear and sharp.

May I ask how I can do that too?

I can't even explain how excited I am for that. I mean between the lander pod and the upcoming and pod you are completely changing the way people play KSP. Full missions completed IVA, that is an incredible option. Even if they don't want to do it IVA the pods are beautiful to look at. Well done!

If I may be permitted to make a few minor requests to fully round out the lander...

  1. The ability to set the navball orientation in IVA (ie: from vertical to horizontal for rover use) would be awesome, though I suspect that implementing that might actually be quite difficult.
  2. The engineering station only offers redundant features of the pilot station rather than parts status and life support/etc. Is it possible to add the ability to display those so when we jump to the engineering station we can see them?
  3. Would it be possible to add a science station that can activate and monitor actual science experiments and sensors, and even transmit data from IVA? I understand programming-wise that is more Mihara's realm, I'm just asking if it could be implemented in the lander space-wise... or do you have some other plans for that third crewmember?

All in all, very impressive. It only reduces the framerate an acceptable bit on my ancient computer in IVA, and I can't wait to see what else you have coming.

Just to let you know, docking in this thing is a breeze

Just.. the information it gives, the presentation, the props... Seriously, Squad should just hire you like today. I can't wait for the 2m pod..

The ability to set the navball orientation in IVA (ie: from vertical to horizontal for rover use) would be awesome, though I suspect that implementing that might actually be quite difficult.

Trivial, actually, because it already works.

  1. Place a probe core on your rover in a correct orientation.
  2. Select it in the targeting menu as the reference part.

Navball is always oriented according to the current reference part, so if your core is oriented correctly so will be the navball.
